item.title: W07 - Spanner
item.description: Spanner FAQ MIT 6.824 Distributed Systems Q: What is time? A: 13:00:00.000 April 7th 2020 UTC is a time. Time advances at a steady rate of one second per second. Q: What is a clock? A: A clock is an oscillator driving a counter. The oscillator should tick at a steady known rate (e.g. one tick per second). The counter must initially be synchronized to a source of the correct time; after that, the oscillator's ticks cause the counter to advance the time.
